channel.title: I am starting to port forward and
channel.description:
I have 2 questions.
1. When I am port forwarding I have an option that it says to do called "Allow individual application(s)" but there is not one called RuneScape or anything. There is a spot to add an application, so what would it be called.
2. After I am done anything, do I have to do anything with my firewall?

item.title: I am starting to port forward and
item.dc:creator: @Joshh Joshh
item.description:
@Joshh wrote:

with your firewall you have to open 43964 or whatever. otherwise the client cant get through to the server.

Read full topic
item.source: I am starting to port forward and

item.title: I am starting to port forward and
item.dc:creator: @Residence Residence
item.description:
@Residence wrote:

well you can name it anything but best is “rsps” runescaspe private server.

and yes you do have to do somthing with your firewall but some computers dont need to , im not sure what you have to do though i have forgoten lol

Read full topic
item.source: I am starting to port forward and

item.title: I am starting to port forward and
item.dc:creator: @Da_0wnz Da 0wnz
item.description:
@Da_0wnz wrote:

It doesn’t matter what you call the application, you could call it ‘server’ or ‘rs’ or ‘runescape’ whatever you like. I don’t believe you have to mess with your firewall. I know that linksys makes you remove one of the options in the security tab but other than that no.

By the way, please make your topic title more specific. It’s part of the rules.

Read full topic
item.source: I am starting to port forward and
